Data update policy

Observations and forecast data is taken from http://www.meteo.fvg.it.
Data is automatically refreshed by the application so that the displayed information will always be fairly up to date. There is no need for a refresh button to force a data download on user demand.

How it works

Data is refreshed when:
- more than N seconds have elapsed since the last download (for the value of N see Menu -> Technical details, Data Update Policy chapter) and:
- the network becomes available after being down or the application is brought to the foreground or the device changes its orientation (the application is restarted by Android).
- Note: the radar image is refreshed each time the radar button is pressed .

When the application is stopped, the current data is saved, and it is restored when the application is brought to the foreground again.
As a consequence, the data displayed when the application starts may not be up to date, at least until the network becomes available and the new data downloaded from the http://www.meteo.fvg.it web site.

Radar map
This radar map (VMI, acronym of Vertical Maximum Intensity) represents the maximum reflectivity value present on the vertical of every point. The VMI can be used for a general monitoring, because it allows to distinguish very well the areas in which occur important phenomena and to classify them basing on their typology (fronts, convective systems, etc). The riflectivity Z is directly correlated to the density, and therefore to the content of water, of the cloud. Values of Z over 10-15 dBZ usually (but not necessarily) mean a precipitation at the ground. The precipitation becomes intense in the areas where the reflectivity is over 40 dBZ and very intense when the values reach and come through the 50 dBZ (typically in correspondence to storms).
The coloured scale representing the dBZ values can be observed on the right of the circle that encloses the radar image.

Active users map

Since version 2.6.1, the Reports map, when tilted with an angle greater than 10 degrees, shows a little circular marker in correspondance of each user whose report background service has been active in the last hour. This kind of data is absolutely anonymous. No user data is collected or shown, even the nick name chosen by the user itself. In order to correlate data into the Meteo.FVG online database (in the context of the web server, not inside the app), only the Android device id is stored (because it is a unique identifier of every device). If you do not want to make part of the active users, turn the Report service off from the Reports section, drop down menu, Notification Service.

Click on the pencil icon in the action bar on the tpo to start reporting the weather in your area. You can report the sky observations, the temprature, the wind strength and add a comment. It is also possible to indicate the locality, if it is available.

After filling in the report form, a weather icon will appear on the map at your location. Click on the icon to see the details and to remove the report. The report will remain valid for 3 hours and will be visible to all users. To change your report, you must first remove it and publish another one.
Long press on a point on the map to start. Long press the marker to move it.
Just confirm your request. You can disable the location name.
The users within a radius of 3 kilometers around the marker will be notified if possible. If somebody replies, you will be notified too. Your request will remain valid for 3 hours.

Requests\n\nWhen a user asks for a weather report in your area within 3 km you receive a notification in the status bar. Activate it to directly go to the weather reports section and reply to her. A request lasts for 3 hours and is represented by a blue marker.
Replies\n\nSomeone replied to your report request. Activate the notification to watch the report. Click on the weather icon to see the detailed report.

The notification service checks for new notifications every five minutes. Disable or enable the service in the Reports section from the drop down menu.\n NOTE I: if the device goes to "sleep" (this normally happens right after screen goes off), the notification service is not run. This is a design compromise solution aimed at balancing utility and battery usage.\n NOTE II: when network is off, the notification service does not run. As a consequence, no battery power is used as far as notifications are concerned.
Go to the Reports section, open the drop down menu on the top right corner and select Report Tutorial to read this guide once again

Long press on a point in the map to start the request. An orange marker will appear. Long press on the marker to change its position. Click on the baloon to start the request procedure.
You can start the request procedure by tilting the map (touch it with two fingers and drag it downwards) and touching a point where users are active.
Once successfully published, the marker turns to green. You can touch the marker and follow the instructions to remove your request. The request will stay valid for 3 hours.
